results.definition: open to two or more interpretations; or of uncertain nature or significance; or (often) intended to mislead
examples: the polling had a complex and equivocal (or ambiguous) message for potential female candidates
the officer's equivocal behavior increased the victim's uneasiness
an equivocal response to an embarrassing question
his conscience reproached him with the equivocal character of the union into which he had forced his son"-Anna Jameson

results.definition: uncertain as a sign or indication
examples: the evidence from bacteriologic analysis was equivocal
